questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST enables an organization to transform its culture to support information security?

choices.D: Requiring third parties to sign confidentiality agreements
choices.A: Including information security clauses within contracts
choices.C: Providing information security training to third-party personnel
choices.B: Auditing the service delivery of third-party providers

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST effective way for an organization to ensure its third-party service providers are aware of information security requirements and expectations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The third party could have 100s to 1000s of customers. They are not going to waist thier man hours getting trained on the security requirements of a single customer. Easy answer... A

Answer is A 
Including information security clauses within contracts is the most effective way for an organization to ensure its third-party service providers are aware of information security requirements and expectations. By explicitly outlining information security requirements and expectations within contracts, organizations establish clear guidelines and obligations for third-party providers to adhere to. These clauses may cover aspects such as data protection, confidentiality, access controls, incident response procedures, and compliance with relevant regulations.

While auditing the service delivery of third-party providers (Option B), providing information security training to third-party personnel (Option C), and requiring third parties to sign confidentiality agreements (Option D) are all important measures, including information security clauses within contracts establishes a formal agreement and legal framework that explicitly addresses information security concerns and responsibilities.

Selected Answer: A
" are AWARE of information security requirements and expectations". AWARE is the key word, so when you sign a contract, you make them legally aware by adding infosec clauses to the contract. You don't just go and train them, ffs. :)

Selected Answer: C
While including information security clauses within contracts (Option A) and auditing the service delivery of third-party providers (Option B) are important aspects of managing third-party security, providing information security training to third-party personnel is a proactive measure to ensure that individuals involved in service delivery understand and adhere to the organization's specific information security requirements. Training helps build awareness, knowledge, and compliance with security policies and practices.

Requiring third parties to sign confidentiality agreements (Option D) is relevant for protecting sensitive information but may not cover the breadth of information security requirements. Information security training directly addresses the need for education and awareness among the personnel responsible for delivering services.
